note_content.Chief Complaint: Chronic dermatitis worsening over the past month
note_content.History of Present Illness:
• Persistent redness and itchiness on lower legs
• Previously controlled with topical steroids
• New patches appeared on arms
note_content.Past Medical History:
• Asthma, controlled with inhaler
• No previous surgeries
note_content.Family History: • Mother with similar skin condition, diagnosed as eczema
note_content.Social History: Tom is a high school teacher, non-smoker, drinks alcohol occasionally on weekends.
note_content.Review of Systems:
• Occasionally wheezing due to asthma
• No fever, weight loss, or night sweats
note_content.Current Medications:
• Inhaler as needed for asthma
• Previously used hydrocortisone cream for skin
note_content.Physical Examination:
• Erythematous and scaly patches on both lower legs
• New similar patches visible on forearms
• No signs of infection

Plan: • Prescribe a stronger topical corticosteroid for two weeks
• Advise to moisturize regularly and avoid known irritants
• Follow-up appointment in two weeks to evaluate response to the treatment
• Consider dermatology referral if no improvement
